snippet: A trip across the country after a fire at an air-traffic control center illustrated, once again, the inflexibility and inefficiencies of flying in the United States.
abstract: Joe Sharkey On the Road column says that a trip across the country after a fire at an air-traffic control center illustrates, once again, the inflexibility and inefficiencies of flying in United States; asserts that delays are running at six-year highs, while airlines pile up tidy profits, raise fares, cut routes and add fees.
lead_paragraph: A trip across the country after a fire at an air-traffic control center illustrated, once again, the inflexibility and inefficiencies of flying in the United States.

headline.print_headline: 2,400 Miles, 39,742 Delays and Many Reminders of Air Travel’s Flaws
headline.main: 2,400 Miles, 39,742 Delays and Many Reminders of Air Travel’s Flaws
